docs.lead_paragraph: The company has adopted a new name, CVS Health, and stopped selling tobacco products in an effort to redefine itself as a health care destination for consumers.

headline.main: CVS Stores Stop Selling All Tobacco Products
headline.print_headline: CVS Stores Stop Selling All Tobacco Products

docs.abstract: CVS locations nationwide will no longer sell tobacco products, fulfilling pledge company made in February as it seeks to reposition itself as a health care destination; rebranding will also include new name of CVS Health.
docs.snippet: The company has adopted a new name, CVS Health, and stopped selling tobacco products in an effort to redefine itself as a health care destination for consumers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Early troubles under the Affordable Care Act are expected to be replaced by new difficulties as insurance prices fluctuate and more people sign up.

headline.main: Bracing for New Challenges in Year 2 of Health Care Law

docs.abstract: Health insurance executives and managers of online insurance marketplaces are girding for coming open enrollment period, saying they fear it could be even more difficult than the first one; consumers will face wide swings in prices and will have shorter time frame for choosing new policy.
docs.snippet: Early troubles under the Affordable Care Act are expected to be replaced by new difficulties as insurance prices fluctuate and more people sign up.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Meet Two Business Owners With Opposing Views on Minimum Wage

docs.abstract: We invited small-business owners who were willing to open their doors to an elected official for a day to let us know by email. Two owners did.
docs.snippet: We invited small-business owners who were willing to open their doors to an elected official for a day to let us know by email. Two owners did.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 200,000 immigrants who bought insurance through President Barack Obama's health care initiative could lose their coverage this month if they don't submit proof this week they are legally in the country, but language barriers and computer glitches are hindering efforts to alert them.

headline.main: Problems Abound With Health Law Immigration Papers
headline.print_headline: Problems Abound With Health Law Immigration Papers

docs.lead_paragraph: Many of the hospitals run by the armed forces are so small and the trickle of patients so thin that doctors and nurses say their ability to properly treat serious illnesses is compromised.

headline.main: Smaller Military Hospitals Said to Put Patients at Risk
headline.print_headline: Smaller Military Hospitals Said to Put Patients at Risk

docs.abstract: Many of nation's military hospitals are so small and have so few patients that doctors and nurses say it compromises their ability to properly diagnose and treat serious illnesses; hospitals run by armed forces are focus of evolving Pentagon plan to scale back system that cares for 1.35 million active-duty service members and their families (Series: Military Medicine).
docs.snippet: Many of the hospitals run by the armed forces are so small and the trickle of patients so thin that doctors and nurses say their ability to properly treat serious illnesses is compromised.

docs.lead_paragraph: In most of the closest congressional races, the two candidates are far apart ideologically.

headline.main: The New Political Rating System That Shows the Stakes This Year
headline.print_headline: New Rating System Charts Nation’s Partisan Chasms

docs.abstract: David Leonhardt The Upshot column; Crowdpac online service uses voting history as well as donor information to rank members of Congress and candidates on liberal to conservative scale; chart shows ideological gaps between candidates in each Senate race for 2014 midterm elections.
docs.snippet: In most of the closest congressional races, the two candidates are far apart ideologically.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress ought to hold hearings on the issue to save more lives on the waiting list and avoid having to pay donors for their organs.

headline.main: Ways to Reduce the Kidney Shortage
headline.print_headline: Ways to Reduce the Kidney Shortage

docs.abstract: Editorial warns of the dearth of kidneys available for transplant around the world; contends first step in easing shortage is to end current waste of organs; call for stronger national campaign to get more people to allow donation of their organs; urges Congress to look for more ways to reduce shortage.
docs.snippet: Congress ought to hold hearings on the issue to save more lives on the waiting list and avoid having to pay donors for their organs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Meryl Comer has written a heartbreaking account of caring for both her husband, who has been debilitated by early-onset Alzheimer’s disease, and her mother, who has the late-onset variety.

headline.seo: Guiding a Husband and a Mother Through Alzheimer’s at the Same Time

docs.abstract: Jane Gross reviews book Slow Dancing With a Stranger: Lost and Found in the Age of Alzheimer's by Meryl Comer.
docs.snippet: Meryl Comer has written a heartbreaking account of caring for both her husband, who has been debilitated by early-onset Alzheimer’s disease, and her mother, who has the late-onset variety.

docs.lead_paragraph: Just as employers replaced pensions with retirement savings plans, more large companies appear to be making a similar cost-sharing shift with health plans.

headline.main: High Health Plan Deductibles Weigh Down More Employees
headline.print_headline: High Health Plan Deductibles Weigh Down More Employees

docs.abstract: More large companies appear to be implementing cost-sharing shift with health plans, similar to how they replaced pensions with retirement savings plans; move to high-deductable plans makes workers responsible for their own care, while employers hope plans will motivate employees to comparison-shop for medical services.
docs.snippet: Just as employers replaced pensions with retirement savings plans, more large companies appear to be making a similar cost-sharing shift with health plans.
